summary:
I need a modern AU were Jon, Theon and Gendry are bff. 
Jon lives with the starks because his parents died when he was a baby....
body:
I need a modern AU were Jon, Theon and Gendry are bff.

Jon lives with the starks because his parents died when he was a baby. Theon is the next door neighbor that spends a lot of time in the starks house because his parents are always traveling.

Gendry is the friend they made in middle school that lives in the dark side of the city but is a sweet bby and always protect his friends. Also, Catelyn and ned love him and always send him food or school supplies with Jon.

Gendrya happens because one day she is walking down the school hallway and he sees a that a boy is making fun of her. And he goes and protect her. He ends at detention and she waits outside the school until the detention is finished. She wants to thank him, Arya has always been the stonger stark and she didn’t tell anybody that she has been bullied on school… not that she cares, she knows she is amazing and the boys are just stupid. Anyway, they kiss and he tells her that he thinks she is beautiful and then he runs home.

Theonsa happens because one day Sansa and Theon are in the same party and there is a boy that Sansa fancies so she ask theon if he could kiss her because she wants to make the other boy jealous. They kiss… and it was amazing so they don’t know what to do with that, they start as friends with benefits.

Gendry has this complex about him and arya and the idea that he is a poor boy and arya needs something better. So the next time they talk he wants to end whatever they could have started. But this time she is the one who kiss him and he even forgets his name. They start a relationship that same day (secret because they dont want to kill jon … yet). And gendry promise himself to be successful and make every effort he can in order to make his life better, and stop feel sad about himself, Arya helps him because she already thinks that he is amazing.

Anyway, Jon almost freaks out when he found theon and sansa making out and then makes the “my best friend and my sister”. Arya and gendry are there and jon goea like “what, you two are together too? Hahaha” and they both nod and Jon faints.

Jon has a love triangle with Ygritte (his first love) and Daenerys (the new girl).

blog.description: Side blog dedicated to Ramin Djawadi + other soundtrack that I like. Expect lots of fantasy related stuff / Askbox is always open :) / Main: @pierrotdameron

tags: the best track of this season ? i think so
summary: Game of Thrones S8 - The Iron Throne - Ramin Djawadi (Official Video)  Enter: "The Iron Throne," title of the episode, title of...
caption:
Game of Thrones S8 - The Iron Throne - Ramin Djawadi (Official Video)

Enter: “The Iron Throne,” title of the episode, title of the piece you wrote, which scores one of the biggest moments in the series: the Iron Throne’s death by dragon fire.

It comes out of “Be With Me.” It starts with a solo violin, and leans on Jon and Daenerys’ love theme, “Truth.” It starts to play again, but it plays very fractured, and it has that same feeling from Jon where he can’t quite grasp what he has done. He’s holding his love in his arms. That’s why the theme plays from the solo violin, very sparse. Then the dragon comes in and the piece starts to pick up. It becomes more powerful and powerful. It builds to what you think is going to happen next: the dragon killing Jon. But he melts the throne. Then the music shifts into a very powerful piece with the main title’s melody in it. Clearly, the real intention is the dragon understands the reason why Daenerys is dead is the urge for power and the throne. I don’t want to say the throne was “useless,” but there are bad things that come out of the urge to get to power. At the same time, Drogon is crying because his mom is dead in front of him. The piece ends with a segment from “Breaker of Chains,” when Daenerys chained her dragons and locked them up [in season four]. There’s a callback to that when he comes in and picks her up and flies away. It’s a very emotional moment. It goes from this powerful, overall message of what is the purpose of the throne and all the death that the throne has brought us, and then it goes small, to the mother and son relationship. I loved writing that scene. I was crying when I wrote it. It was so emotional.

‘Game of Thrones’ Series Finale: Ramin Djawadi Charts the Final Season’s Musical Journey

He’s holding his love in his arms. That’s why the theme plays from the solo violin, very sparse. Then the dragon comes in and the piece starts to pick up. It becomes more powerful and powerful. It builds to what you think is going to happen next: the dragon killing Jon. But he melts the throne. Then the music shifts into a very powerful piece with the main title’s melody in it. Clearly, the real intention is the dragon understands the reason why Daenerys is dead is the urge for power and the throne. I don’t want to say the throne was “useless,” but there are bad things that come out of the urge to get to power. At the same time, Drogon is crying because his mom is dead in front of him. The piece ends with a segment from “Breaker of Chains,” when Daenerys chained her dragons and locked them up [in season four]. It goes from this powerful, overall message of what is the purpose of the throne and all the death that the throne has brought us, and then it goes small, to the mother and son relationship. I loved writing that scene. I was crying when I wrote it. It was so emotional.

‘Game of Thrones’ Series Finale: Ramin Djawadi Charts the Final Season’s Musical Journey
trail.content:
Game of Thrones S8 - The Iron Throne - Ramin Djawadi (Official Video)

Enter: “The Iron Throne,” title of the episode, title of the piece you wrote, which scores one of the biggest moments in the series: the Iron Throne’s death by dragon fire.

It comes out of “Be With Me.” It starts with a solo violin, and leans on Jon and Daenerys’ love theme, “Truth.” It starts to play again, but it plays very fractured, and it has that same feeling from Jon where he can’t quite grasp what he has done. He’s holding his love in his arms. That’s why the theme plays from the solo violin, very sparse. Then the dragon comes in and the piece starts to pick up. It becomes more powerful and powerful. It builds to what you think is going to happen next: the dragon killing Jon. But he melts the throne. Then the music shifts into a very powerful piece with the main title’s melody in it. Clearly, the real intention is the dragon understands the reason why Daenerys is dead is the urge for power and the throne. I don’t want to say the throne was “useless,” but there are bad things that come out of the urge to get to power. At the same time, Drogon is crying because his mom is dead in front of him. The piece ends with a segment from “Breaker of Chains,” when Daenerys chained her dragons and locked them up [in season four]. There’s a callback to that when he comes in and picks her up and flies away. It’s a very emotional moment. It goes from this powerful, overall message of what is the purpose of the throne and all the death that the throne has brought us, and then it goes small, to the mother and son relationship. I loved writing that scene. I was crying when I wrote it. It was so emotional.

blog.name: qboo78
blog.title: Love you 3000
blog.description:
Jon Snow is in love with Sansa Stark. Sansa Stark is in love with Jon Snow. Bellamy and Clarke IS.
#marriedBeliza

summary: Keeping an OATH vs Saving a Loved one? - Sansa always many steps ahead of everyone
body:
Keeping an OATH vs Saving a Loved one? - Sansa always many steps ahead of everyone

Why do you say Sansa broke her promise to Jon to keep his secret? It’s easy. Because Sansa knew Jon is in danger and the North is in danger. Where did she come up with that idea that Jon is in danger? oh only because Tyrion is SCARED of Danaerys, the same Tyrion who has been part of a family of tyrants, (Joffrey, Cersei, Tywin) is scared of this dragon riding Targaryen. Oh did we mention a Targaryen? Yeah the ones who burn people and CONQUERS 7 Kingdoms because they CAN. The ones who were cast out in a rebellion and was forced to flee which has given her a motive for revenge and out for blood? Yeah that Targaryen. Sansa knows how power hungry people works, she knows very well what lengths they will go to keep a secret and Jon’s secret is bound to make him very vulnerable and a threat to Danaerys because he IS the rightful heir to the throne. Let’s face it. Sooner or later, Jon’s secret will out and as more and more Danaerys acquires power then more and more she will grow paranoid and guard that power jealously. She will always be afraid that Jon will usurped her rulership and she very well knew Jon is within his rights because she is not the rightful ruler Jon is. She herself has always put so much stock in the rightful ruler scenario because that has always been her justification in burning people and taking from people what was never hers. Danaerys also knows that people in Westeros will never love her but will always fear her so her paranoia will grow and grow until she is going to do something about Jon’s secret… She was already paranoid before with Tyrion when he asked her about heirs. She was already paranoid with Varys when she warns Varys that if he betrays her she will burn him alive. And she never likes being questioned but unfortunately she will always be surrounded by people who will question her if she wants to continue to rule over Westeros. The people of Westeros have gone through so many wars for them to ever accept power hungry tyrants lying down ever again. It was the reason Joffrey was killed because he is one. It was the reason Ramsey was killed because he is one. It was the reason Stannis was killed because he is one.

Sansa is already a dozen or more steps ahead of everyone because she already had lived through this exact same scenario before with the Lannisters where her father ended up dead, her becoming a prisoner, her mother and brothers murdered and The NORTH becoming the one to experience the biggest collateral damage of all because of a Secret. So she already knows that it will definitely become a problem for Jon. Jon is in danger, the same way her father Ned Stark was in danger and the same way her grandfather and uncle were in danger. Jon has a birth secret and he is under a Targaryen that has already burned people alive in Westeros (remember the Battle of Goldroad everyone? And the Tarlys?) and worst of all that same Targaryen knows Jon’s secret.

Littlefinger is a real creep but he really did gave Sansa the best advice

“Don’t fight in the North, or the South. Fight every battle, everywhere, always, in your mind”

The same way Varys knew what Danaerys will do to King’s Landing and what will happen when she goes to attack King’s Landing, Sansa already knew that Danaerys will do that. It wasn’t Sansa telling Tyrion the secret that made Danaerys decide to attack and burn King’s Landing even after they surrender. Nope. Danaerys already made that decision when her dragon died and Missandei was beheaded in front of her. She already has always been out for blood for the family that headed the Rebellion before and cast her out and forced her to flee. She already wanted to reign fire and blood on them. Rhaegal and Missandei getting killed was just the last straw that broke the camel’s back. Sansa knew that because she is already twenty or more steps ahead of them and Varys for sure definitely knows that when he talked with Danaerys advising her to remember that there are innocents out there in the keep. Varys looked into Daenarys’ eyes and he knew who she is and what she will do. Varys has served many many tyrants for a long time and has long been acquainted with tyrants and definitely recognizes one when it’s staring at him in the face when finally Danaerys sheds her “savior” persona in front of them. Remember what Arya said to Jon? “I know a killer when I see one” that is why Arya’s instincts also tells her that she doesn’t trust Danaerys. It wasn’t just Sansa who doesn’t trust her.

Sansa wanted Jon to have allies there. Sansa wanted Jon to have a fighting chance just in case but more so Sansa wants to let Jon know that she still chooses Jon as her king. And she will always choose Jon as her King. You witnessed it when she told Bran that she loves him but he is not her king and not the North’s King and we knew that when she told Jon “the North lost their King”. Oh, by the way Jon chose Sansa too. He chose to protect Sansa and keep his promise to her to protect her.

In conclusion, and this is how I imagine what happens next in their story.

Knowing Sansa, her first act as Queen in the North will be to pardon Jon and to declare him a Stark. How can she not? when she knows Jon will want to go home to Winterfell. The same way Bran will yearn to go home to Winterfell even though he is King of the South and Arya will always want to go home to Winterfell after her exploring. Winterfell is their home and the wolves will always come back again. So, Sansa wiĺl pull a Nick Fury on the decision that was made as punishment for Jon during the second dragonpit summit and will tell Bran and the Southern Lords that the Wall is of the North and since She is Queen in the North then she can pardon whoever she wants to pardon in the North! And declare to all the North that Jon Snow is free to finally come home at last to Winterfell. And in honour of what Jon Snow did in uniting the North, leading the Army of the Living to fight the Army of the Dead and protecting all of Westeros by killing the Dragon Queen stopping her from burning more innocents, women and children ever again, she declares Jon Snow as Jon Stark, Protector of the Realm.

I doubt Bran will object and Tyrion and the council certainly won’t object. Oh and the Unsullied??? They are already living in peace in Naath so why should they go back to Westeros when they would just face all of Westeros in the battle now that the people of Westeros have finally united in one common goal. Why would Greyworm risked that. So yeah Sansa can definitely do what she wants. And what does she want? To save Jon and bring him home. That is what she wants.

reblog.comment:
Keeping an OATH vs Saving a Loved one? - Sansa always many steps ahead of everyone

Why do you say Sansa broke her promise to Jon to keep his secret? It’s easy. Because Sansa knew Jon is in danger and the North is in danger. Where did she come up with that idea that Jon is in danger? oh only because Tyrion is SCARED of Danaerys, the same Tyrion who has been part of a family of tyrants, (Joffrey, Cersei, Tywin) is scared of this dragon riding Targaryen. Oh did we mention a Targaryen? Yeah the ones who burn people and CONQUERS 7 Kingdoms because they CAN. The ones who were cast out in a rebellion and was forced to flee which has given her a motive for revenge and out for blood? Yeah that Targaryen. Sansa knows how power hungry people works, she knows very well what lengths they will go to keep a secret and Jon’s secret is bound to make him very vulnerable and a threat to Danaerys because he IS the rightful heir to the throne. Let’s face it. Sooner or later, Jon’s secret will out and as more and more Danaerys acquires power then more and more she will grow paranoid and guard that power jealously. She will always be afraid that Jon will usurped her rulership and she very well knew Jon is within his rights because she is not the rightful ruler Jon is. She herself has always put so much stock in the rightful ruler scenario because that has always been her justification in burning people and taking from people what was never hers. Danaerys also knows that people in Westeros will never love her but will always fear her so her paranoia will grow and grow until she is going to do something about Jon’s secret… She was already paranoid before with Tyrion when he asked her about heirs. She was already paranoid with Varys when she warns Varys that if he betrays her she will burn him alive. And she never likes being questioned but unfortunately she will always be surrounded by people who will question her if she wants to continue to rule over Westeros. The people of Westeros have gone through so many wars for them to ever accept power hungry tyrants lying down ever again. It was the reason Joffrey was killed because he is one. It was the reason Ramsey was killed because he is one. It was the reason Stannis was killed because he is one.

Sansa is already a dozen or more steps ahead of everyone because she already had lived through this exact same scenario before with the Lannisters where her father ended up dead, her becoming a prisoner, her mother and brothers murdered and The NORTH becoming the one to experience the biggest collateral damage of all because of a Secret. So she already knows that it will definitely become a problem for Jon. Jon is in danger, the same way her father Ned Stark was in danger and the same way her grandfather and uncle were in danger. Jon has a birth secret and he is under a Targaryen that has already burned people alive in Westeros (remember the Battle of Goldroad everyone? And the Tarlys?) and worst of all that same Targaryen knows Jon’s secret.

Littlefinger is a real creep but he really did gave Sansa the best advice

“Don’t fight in the North, or the South. Fight every battle, everywhere, always, in your mind”

The same way Varys knew what Danaerys will do to King’s Landing and what will happen when she goes to attack King’s Landing, Sansa already knew that Danaerys will do that. It wasn’t Sansa telling Tyrion the secret that made Danaerys decide to attack and burn King’s Landing even after they surrender. Nope. Danaerys already made that decision when her dragon died and Missandei was beheaded in front of her. She already has always been out for blood for the family that headed the Rebellion before and cast her out and forced her to flee. She already wanted to reign fire and blood on them. Rhaegal and Missandei getting killed was just the last straw that broke the camel’s back. Sansa knew that because she is already twenty or more steps ahead of them and Varys for sure definitely knows that when he talked with Danaerys advising her to remember that there are innocents out there in the keep. Varys looked into Daenarys’ eyes and he knew who she is and what she will do. Varys has served many many tyrants for a long time and has long been acquainted with tyrants and definitely recognizes one when it’s staring at him in the face when finally Danaerys sheds her “savior” persona in front of them. Remember what Arya said to Jon? “I know a killer when I see one” that is why Arya’s instincts also tells her that she doesn’t trust Danaerys. It wasn’t just Sansa who doesn’t trust her.

Sansa wanted Jon to have allies there. Sansa wanted Jon to have a fighting chance just in case but more so Sansa wants to let Jon know that she still chooses Jon as her king. And she will always choose Jon as her King. You witnessed it when she told Bran that she loves him but he is not her king and not the North’s King and we knew that when she told Jon “the North lost their King”. Oh, by the way Jon chose Sansa too. He chose to protect Sansa and keep his promise to her to protect her.

In conclusion, and this is how I imagine what happens next in their story.

Knowing Sansa, her first act as Queen in the North will be to pardon Jon and to declare him a Stark. How can she not? when she knows Jon will want to go home to Winterfell. The same way Bran will yearn to go home to Winterfell even though he is King of the South and Arya will always want to go home to Winterfell after her exploring. Winterfell is their home and the wolves will always come back again. So, Sansa wiĺl pull a Nick Fury on the decision that was made as punishment for Jon during the second dragonpit summit and will tell Bran and the Southern Lords that the Wall is of the North and since She is Queen in the North then she can pardon whoever she wants to pardon in the North! And declare to all the North that Jon Snow is free to finally come home at last to Winterfell. And in honour of what Jon Snow did in uniting the North, leading the Army of the Living to fight the Army of the Dead and protecting all of Westeros by killing the Dragon Queen stopping her from burning more innocents, women and children ever again, she declares Jon Snow as Jon Stark, Protector of the Realm.

I doubt Bran will object and Tyrion and the council certainly won’t object. Oh and the Unsullied??? Why would Greyworm risked that. So yeah Sansa can definitely do what she wants. And what does she want? To save Jon and bring him home. That is what she wants.
